abstract: A buyout consortium looks set to recoup its investment in HD Supply and then some in an upcoming initial public offering. But Home Depot fared even better.
snippet: A buyout consortium looks set to recoup its investment in HD Supply and then some in an upcoming initial public offering. But Home Depot fared even better.
lead_paragraph: Home Depot has outflipped and outstripped private equity. A buyout consortium led by the Carlyle Group acquired Home Depot’s wholesale arm for $8.5 billion just before the real estate bubble popped. On paper, the firms should recoup their HD Supply investment and then some in an upcoming initial public offering. But Home Depot fared even better.
